evidence.text: First, defendants’ recent policies and actions violate the Administrative Procedure Act (APA).
defendants’ policies and actions contravene Spending Clause and other separation-of-powers constraints

extracted.value: Constitutional claims (Spending Clause, separation of powers)

evidence.text: The Court should set aside NIH’s unlawful blacklisting policies—and the actions taken to implement those policies—and compel the review of applications that the agency has unlawfully withheld.

extracted.value: Set aside unlawful blacklisting policies and compel review of withheld applications

evidence.text: This action arises under U.S. Constitution; the APA, 5 U.S.C. §701 et seq.; the Public Health Service Act (PHSA), 42 U.S.C. §201 et seq.; and federal regulations governing NIH grants.

extracted.value: Administrative Procedure Act (APA), 5 U.S.C. §701 et seq.
